qas.question: What can scales and spring balances measure between two forces by using static equilibrium?
What force acts on an object suspended on a spring scale in addition to gravity?
What equals the spring reaction force on an object suspended on a spring reaction scale?
Objects of constant density are proportional to volume by what force to define standard weights?.
Who expounded the Three Laws of Motion?
A static equilibrium between three sources is a way of doing what?
Complex devices such as weighing scales are used when measuring what?
An object suspended on a horizontal spring scale experiences the force of what?
All quantitative force laws were discovered using what?

context: A <a0_1>static equilibrium<a0_1/> between two forces is the most usual way of <b5_0>measuring <a0_0><a0_2><a0_4><b6_0>forces<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_4/><a0_2/><a0_0/>, using simple devices such as weighing scales and spring balances. For example, an object suspended on a vertical spring scale experiences <a1_2>the <a0_3>force of <a2_0><b7_0>gravity<b7_0/><a2_0/><a1_2/><a0_3/> acting on the object balanced by a force applied by the "<a1_0><a1_1><a1_3><a1_4><a2_2>spring reaction<a1_3/> force<a2_2/><a1_4/><a1_1/><a1_0/>", which equals <a2_3><a2_4>the <a2_1>object's weight<a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_1/>. Using such <b8_0>tools<b8_0/>, some quantitative force laws were discovered: that <a3_2><a3_4>the <a3_3>force of <a3_0><a3_1>gravity<a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> is proportional to volume for objects of constant density (widely exploited for millennia to define standard weights); Archimedes' principle for buoyancy; Archimedes' analysis of the lever; Boyle's law for gas pressure; and Hooke's law for springs. These were all formulated and experimentally verified before <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><a4_4>Isaac Newton<a4_4/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> expounded his Three Laws of Motion.
